name: Escape Wales
description:
A small german serious game about the biggest manhunt in World War II.

Story The game is based on real events that took place in the British POW Camp 198 during WWII. There, on March 10, 1945, 84 German prisoners escaped through a self-made tunnel. The main character is the young German Karl, who lives with his parents on a farm near Aachen. One fateful day, he was drafted by the Wehrmacht and used to work on the Siegfried Line. He is captured by Allied soldiers and taken prisoner of war at Camp 198 in South Wales.

The Team

This project was created by WRNBL Games, a group of students from the university SRH Heidelberg. This is the exam for the end of the second semester. Jan - Lead Programmer, Project Lead Max - Programmer, Level Scripting Leon - Programmer, Level Scripting Tim - Art, Level Design

Controls W,A,S,D - Walk Spacebar - Jump Crouch - C Interaction with objects - E Enter - Progress dialogue Backspace - Pause

Install instructions Extract the .rar with 7-Zip or WinRAR and start the .exe inside the extracted folder. The game is only available for Windows platforms.
